item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: More rubbish dumped on Furzefield Road, 26th July
item.description:
This is totally unacceptable and a serious health hazard, The council must do something. As this has become a regular occurrence since towards the end of June. There are soiled nappies and food waste all over the road. I will be contacting my councillors and asking them to involve environmental health. I have picked up the rubbish on this occasion. I would also point out that the alley way between Furzefield Road and Hassendean Road is also full of black rubbish bags

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Furzefield Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped unit, 26th July
item.description:

item.title: Between number 11 and 13, 26th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Hampstead Hill Gardens, Belsize Park, London

item.title: The Van is left on idle for more than an hour now, 26th July
item.description:
I have talked to the drivers, they seems to have a break and smoked cigarettes downstairs, I asked them kindly if that’s their car and if they can put it off, and they only looked at their watch say they will not shut it down.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dean Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Caught in the act, 26th July
item.description:
Another delightful neighbour, dumping human excrement and their rubbish. Can we get a sign put up with a nigerian and turkish translation? Not one letter has been sent out to the tenants reminding them of their tenancy agreement.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Broke Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
